_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The battles between the gods and the dem: The first battle between the gods and the demons
The second battle between the gods and the demons
The third battle between the gods and the demons
The fourth battle between the gods and the demons
The secure location of the mendicant (a: The mendicant enters and remains in the first absorption
The mendicant enters and remains in the second absorption
The mendicant enters and remains in the third absorption
The mendicant enters and remains in the fourth absorption
The mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of infinite space
The mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of infinite consciousness
The mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of nothingness
The mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
The mendicant enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling
The achievement of the mendicant (a caus: The mendicant puts out Māra's eyes without a trace
The mendicant goes where the Wicked One cannot see
The mendicant's defilements come to an end
The mendicant crosses over clinging to the world.
